org.jgrapes.io.util

Class ManagedBuffer<T extends Buffer>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapes.io.util.ManagedBuffer<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ManagedByteBuffer, ManagedCharBuffer

    public abstract class ManagedBuffer<T extends Buffer>
extends Object

    A wrapper around a Buffer that maintains a lock count for that buffer. All methods known from Buffer are provided and delegate to the backing buffer. Managed buffers can be used to maintain pools of buffers. Buffers are locked when retrieved from the pool and can automatically be returned when the last lock is released.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ManagedBuffer

        public ManagedBuffer(T buffer,
                     BufferCollector manager)

        Create a new Managed buffer, backed by the given buffer, with a lock count of one.

        Parameters:
        buffer - the backing buffer
        manager - used for restoring the buffer when the lock count reaches zero

    • Method Detail

      • getBacking

        public T getBacking()

        Return the backing buffer.

        Returns:
        the buffer

      • lockBuffer

        public ManagedBuffer<T> lockBuffer()

        Increases the buffer’s lock count.

        Returns:
        the managed buffer for easy chaining

      • unlockBuffer

        public void unlockBuffer()
                  throws IllegalStateException

        Decreases the buffer’s lock count. If the lock count reached zero, the buffer collect’s BufferCollector.recollect(org.jgrapes.io.util.ManagedBuffer<?>) method is invoked.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the buffer is not locked or has been released already
